intro: Buccaferrea densa, commonly known as the dense buccaferrea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its thick, woody stems and large, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid, shaded environments.
